p: The FTIR spectra, peak values and probable functional group of chloroform crude extract obtained from P. aeruginosa KD155 are presented in Fig. 8 and Table 5. The identification of functional group present in the active components is identified based on the region of IR radiation displayed as peak values in FT-IR spectrum. When the extract was passed into the FT-IR, the functional groups of the components were separated based on its peaks ratio. The absorbance bands analysis in bioreduction process are observed in the region between 400–4000 cm −1. The FTIR analysis of the crude extract revealed peak of different functional groups at 766 cm −1 showing bending in C—H bond, 930 cm −1 (C=C Bending), peak at 1043 cm −1 shows stretching in S=O bond, 1236 cm −1 (C-O Stretching), 1516 cm −1 (C-N Stretching), 1883 cm −1 (C-H Bending), 1992 cm −1 (C=N Stretching), 2140 cm −1 (C=O Stretching), intramolecular forces between O-H group was evident from the peak 2424−2623 cm −1 (O-H Intramolecular forces), 2623 cm −1 (S-H Stretching), 2856−3280 cm −1 (C-H Stretching), 3677 cm −1 (O-H Stretching) ( Table 5, Fig. 8).
